original_definition: 'year-ahead' means the year prior to the calendar year of operation;
generated_definition: 'year-ahead' means a plan for the upcoming year in the electricity sector, detailing the availability of assets and outages for coordination among transmission system operators (tsos).

Article 3: ‘year-ahead’ means the year prior to the calendar year of operation;

Article 65: 1.   All TSOs shall jointly develop a common list of year-ahead scenarios against which they assess the operation of the interconnected transmission system for the following year. Those scenarios shall allow the identification and the assessment of the influence of the interconnected transmission system on operational security. Article 66: 1.   Each TSO shall determine a year-ahead individual grid model for each of the scenarios developed pursuant to Article 65, using its best estimates of the variables defined in Article 65(1). Each TSO shall publish its year-ahead individual grid models on the ENTSO for Electricity operational planning data environment in accordance with Article 114(1).

Article 67: deadlines for gathering the year-ahead individual grid models, for merging them into a common grid model and for saving the individual and common grid models;

1.   By 6 months after entry into force of this Regulation, all TSOs shall jointly develop a proposal for the methodology for building the year-ahead common grid models from the individual grid models established in accordance with Article 66(1) and for saving them. The methodology shall take into account, and complement where necessary, the operational conditions of the common grid model methodology developed in accordance with Article 17 of Regulation (EU) 2015/1222 and Article 18 of Regulation (EU) 2016/1719, as regards the following elements:
Article 68: 1.   When a TSO modifies or notices a modification of its best estimates for the variables used for determining its year-ahead individual grid model established in accordance with Article 66(1), which is significant for operational security, it shall update its year-ahead individual grid model and publish it on the ENTSO for Electricity operational planning data environment.

1.   When a TSO modifies or notices a modification of its best estimates for the variables used for determining itsyear-aheadindividual grid model established in accordance with Article 66(1), which is significant foroperational security, it shall update its year-ahead individual grid model and publish it on theENTSO for Electricity operational planning data environment.
2.   Whenever an individual grid model is updated, the year-ahead common grid model shall be updated accordingly applying the methodology determined in accordance with Article 67(1).

Article 91: Variations to deadlines for the year-ahead outage coordination

All TSOs within a synchronous area may jointly agree to adopt and implement a time-frame for the year-ahead outage coordination that deviates from the time-frame defined in Articles 94, 97 and 99, provided that the outage coordination of other synchronous areas is not impacted.
Article 92: 4.   The availability status for each relevant asset in the year-ahead time-frame shall be provided with daily resolution.
